page.title: 07FIELD PATTERNS
page.content: The fields are very large and in recent years many hedges have been removed to allow the use of tractors and large agricultural machinery. Although the land is very flat, many of the fields are strange shapes. This is often caused by the boundaries being old creeks from the time when the land was salt marsh. As for the roads, in the olden days cattle were driven to the marsh to feed. They wandered in wiggly lines and this may account for the road pattern. As we walked around our area we noticed that many fields on the 6" map had ponds marked. These no longer existed because now that horses are not used there is no need to provide them with drinking water. Being low lying, many of the fields are bordered by dykes, for drainage.
